docs.snippet: Maj. Gen. William A. Knowlton, superintendent of the United States Military Academy, disclosed last night that plans had been submitted to the Pentagon for the construction of a Jewish chapel and religious center at West Point....
docs.lead_paragraph: Maj. Gen. William A. Knowlton, superintendent of the United States Military Academy, disclosed last night that plans had been submitted to the Pentagon for the construction of a Jewish chapel and religious center at West Point.
docs.abstract: Maj Gen Knowlton, acad supt, discloses plans have been submitted to Defense Dept to build Jewish chapel and religious center; M Abramovitz is architect; cost put at $1.8-million; rendering; Knowlton gets Mt Neboh Congregation brotherhood award for encouraging young men from ethnic minorities to seek admission to acad

headline.main: West Point Head Offers Plans For $1.6-Million Jewish Chapel

docs.snippet: The Penn Central Company, which conceded earlier this week that it was in technical default on certain obligations of a European subsidiary, expects to announce in the next few days, possibly by tomorrow, that agreement has been reached to extend ...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Penn Central Company, which conceded earlier this week that it was in technical default on certain obligations of a European subsidiary, expects to announce in the next few days, possibly by tomorrow, that agreement has been reached to extend the maturities of the debt involved.
docs.abstract: Penn Central Co, which conceded earlier that it was in tech default on certain obligations of Eur subsidiary, expects to announce agreement to extend maturities of debt involved; debt consists of $59-million of promissory notes in Swiss francs with 10.1% interest rate made in '70 by Penn Central Internatl NV, Netherlands subsidiary of Penn Central Co; Penn Central lawyer J Subak concedes that if negotiations for maturity extension fail, noteholders could foreclose on Penn Central Co; observers note that bankruptcy of co would have entirely different effects than reorgn of rr; Amer Express Internatl Banking Corp and Union Bank of Los Angeles, holders of $7-million of Penn Central's Swiss promissory notes, file suit in Fed ct charging that notes were sold to them under fraudulant circumstances; defendants in suit listed

headline.main: Pennsy Sees Debt Pact; DEBT PACT SEEN BY PENN CENTRAL

docs.snippet: HOLLYWOOD, Feb. 22 (AP) -"Airport" and "Patton" scored top honors in the 43d nominations of the Motion Picture Academy of Arts and Sciences today with 10 apiece. "Love Story" placed third with seven, followed by "M*A*S*H" and "Tora! Tora! Tora!" w...
docs.lead_paragraph: HOLLYWOOD, Feb. 22 (AP) -"Airport" and "Patton" scored top honors in the 43d nominations of the Motion Picture Academy of Arts and Sciences today with 10 apiece. "Love Story" placed third with seven, followed by "M*A*S*H" and "Tora! Tora! Tora!" with five each.
docs.abstract: Acad Award nominations; actor G C Scott refuses best actor nomination; nominations listed

headline.main: ' AIRPORT,' 'PATTON' TOP OSCAR ENTRIES; Win 10 Nominations Each -'Love Story' Garners 7

docs.snippet: HE came from out of the north by northwest, and hardly anyone had heard of him. And then all of a sudden, THERE HE WAS: A 71-year-old Indian chief from British Columbia with a flowing silver mane and a kindly, hewn-out-of-buckskin face and 36 gran...
docs.lead_paragraph: HE came from out of the north by northwest, and hardly anyone had heard of him. And then all of a sudden, THERE HE WAS: A 71-year-old Indian chief from British Columbia with a flowing silver mane and a kindly, hewn-out-of-buckskin face and 36 grandchildren.

headline.main: Dustin Calls Him Grandpa; Chief Dan George

docs.snippet: The urban crisis -- supplanted now by newer ones (pollution has spun off into its own full-blown crisis) -- seems to have diminishing urgency precisely as the situation becomes increasingly critical. Not that the urban crisis was ever quite define...
docs.lead_paragraph: The urban crisis -- supplanted now by newer ones (pollution has spun off into its own full-blown crisis) -- seems to have diminishing urgency precisely as the situation becomes increasingly critical. Not that the urban crisis was ever quite defined; we each supply our own definition according to where we live, how quickly we accept ready answers and how much we are inconvenienced, threatened or thwarted by our separate urban worlds.
docs.abstract: Paperback books on urban crisis revd (part 2)

headline.main: Agreed: Something Has to Be Done; Cities

docs.snippet: Puerto Rican students at City College occupied offices of the romance languages department yesterday for six hours to underscore their demands "that our problems be immediately considered."...
docs.lead_paragraph: Puerto Rican students at City College occupied offices of the romance languages department yesterday for six hours to underscore their demands "that our problems be immediately considered."
docs.abstract: Members of Puerto Rican Student Union end 6-hr occupation of coll's romance language dept to emphasize demands after speaking with pres Marshak and dean Chevarria-Aguilar on issues; group's demands include hiring of Puerto Ricans to teach Puerto Rican studies courses, student participation in hiring of faculty and design of such courses, more Puerto Rican students and counselors in SEEK program and probe of recent layoff of cafeteria workers; students claim their demands have not been given serious consideration by faculty and adm; Marshak accuses union of not cooperating fully in presenting grievances through regular channels; says he has recd rept from faculty member on proposed plan for Puerto Rican studies dept

headline.main: Puerto Rican Students Occupy C.C.N.Y. Offices for 6 Hours
